title: Ticket #5610: windows debug build doesn't link to debug build of boost-python
description:
When building on Windows in Debug mode, the python bindings are linked to the non-debug version of boost-python.

There is some hackery involved in fooling the linker into resolving everything anyway, but the result is non-functional bindings.

The correct solution is to link with the debug version of boost-python, and to prevent pyconfig.h from seeing the _DEBUG define so that we end up with debug boost but not the debug version of Python (python27_d.dll).

the boost headers will insure that python doesn't see the _DEBUG flag, but for this to work, we must always include python headers via the boost/python headers rather than using them naked.
